details.title: Complementary-based chaotic phase-coded waveforms design for MIMO radar

authors.affiliation: National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, People's Republic of China
authors.name: Yang Jin

authors.affiliation: National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, People's Republic of China
authors.name: Hongqiang Wang

authors.affiliation: National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, People's Republic of China
authors.name: Weidong Jiang

authors.affiliation: National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, People's Republic of China
authors.name: Zhaowen Zhuang

details.abstract: This study deals with orthogonal waveform design for multi-input multi-output (MIMO) radar. Chaos is introduced to generate orthogonal phase-coded waveforms of arbitrary coded length for arbitrary number of transmitters. However, most of these chaos-based waveforms suffer high range sidelobe level and intrapulse Doppler intolerance for pulse compression. A complementary transmitting structure is proposed for the MIMO radar to supress these high range sidelobes, and an adaptive clonal selection algorithm is introduced to search for the optimal complementary codes of the transmitted chaotic phase-coded waveform. This algorithm proves that it is convergent in theory as well. A multiple hypotheses approach is introduced at the transmitters to estimate and then compensate for the intrapulse Doppler phase shift for MIMO radar pulse compression countering the intrapulse Doppler intolerance. Numerical simulations with four typical chaotic maps are carried out and compared with Deng's codes, which validate the proposed methods of this study.

ieee.title: MIMO OFDM radar IRCI free range reconstruction with sufficient cyclic prefix
ieee.displayText: Xiang-gen Xia, Tianxian Zhang, Lingjiang Kong, "MIMO OFDM radar IRCI free range reconstruction with sufficient cyclic prefix", Aerospace and Electronic Systems IEEE Transactions on, vol. 51, pp. 2276-2293, 2015, ISSN 0018-9251.

ieee.title: Interleaved OFDM Signals for MIMO Radar
ieee.displayText: Zhibin Lin, Zongbo Wang, "Interleaved OFDM Signals for MIMO Radar", Sensors Journal IEEE, vol. 15, pp. 6294-6305, 2015, ISSN 1530-437X.

ieee.title: A new multicarrier chaotic phase coded stepped-frequency pulse train radar signal and its characteristic analysis
ieee.displayText: Huang Qiongdan, Li Yong, Cheng Wei, Liu Weihua, Li Bo, "A new multicarrier chaotic phase coded stepped-frequency pulse train radar signal and its characteristic analysis", Industrial Electronics and Applications (ICIEA) 2015 IEEE 10th Conference on, pp. 444-448, 2015.

ieee.title: Piecewise LFM waveform for MIMO radar
ieee.displayText: Caicai Gao, Kah Chan Teh, Aifei Liu, Hongbo Sun, "Piecewise LFM waveform for MIMO radar", Aerospace and Electronic Systems IEEE Transactions on, vol. 52, pp. 590-602, 2016, ISSN 0018-9251.

ieee.title: Orthogonal Frequency Diversity Waveform with Range-Doppler Optimization for MIMO Radar
ieee.displayText: Caicai Gao, Kah Chan Teh, Aifei Liu, "Orthogonal Frequency Diversity Waveform with Range-Doppler Optimization for MIMO Radar", Signal Processing Letters IEEE, vol. 21, pp. 1201-1205, 2014, ISSN 1070-9908.

ieee.title: Designing Sequence With Minimum PSL Using Chebyshev Distance and its Application for Chaotic MIMO Radar Waveform Design
ieee.displayText: Hamid Esmaeili-Najafabadi, Mohammad Ataei, Mohammad Farzan Sabahi, "Designing Sequence With Minimum PSL Using Chebyshev Distance and its Application for Chaotic MIMO Radar Waveform Design", Signal Processing IEEE Transactions on, vol. 65, pp. 690-704, 2017, ISSN 1053-587X.
